alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Southern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:32PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Custer, southeastern Lawrence and southwestern Pennington Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 131 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Roubaix Lake to 2 miles southwest of Silver City to 2 miles southeast of Black Elk Peak. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pactola Reservoir, Black Elk Peak, Mount Rushmore National Memorial, Horse Thief Lake, Sylvan Lake, northern Custer State Park, Palmer Gulch Resort, Keystone Wye and Crazy Horse Memorial around 135 PM MDT. Keystone around 150 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hill City, Black Hills Playhouse, Center Lake and Sheridan Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Southern Black Hills
